commentText: One of the best songs ever created. Thank you Danheim.
Krig!
powerful

I don't know Ivar's real story in detail, but in the show I can totally understand his contempt for his idiot brothers, allying themselves with the woman who killed their own mother. Even Bjorn has been behaving like an idiot, hurting Torvi, as if she hasn't yet been through enough in life. In real life I believe everybody would call that a prick. I used to really like the child Bjorn but care very little, if nothing, for the adult one. Who cares about his dumb random trips to the Mediterranean, boring. If I were Ivar I would feel contemptuous towards all of them too. His rage is justified, because he is surrounded by incapable betraying idiots.

replies.commentText: Selma Faria dang. I didn‚Äôt see it that way before, but you‚Äôre right. I just thought they were all being idiots after Ragnar.
Selma Faria I see your points and agree totally...

Interesting perspective. I like Bjorn a lot, but his betrayal of Torvi was heart breaking. I understand Ubbe allying with Bjorn and Lagertha, but I also understand Ivar and Hviserk's perspective. Of course, they all need to look out for Rollo and Bishop Headmund
Selma Faria Ivar didn't really kill his brother. That is just a twist in the Viking show.

I agree that Ivar is smarter and alot less predictable than all of his brothers including bjorn. However, you cannot dismiss the fact that Ivar doesn't stand a slight chance against bjorn in a personal duel, the only way Ivar could triumph over bjorn, the rest of his brothers, and largetha would be politics, deception, and leading a great army against them that it is his to control.

Yuval Vernik There's almost no way Ivar will challenge Bjorn to a duel, nor will he accept one if Bjorn challenges him. Like you said, his strengths lie in strategy and leadership. It will be interesting to see if he gets involved in the fighting more, now that he's teaching himself to walk

Yes indeed I agree, but if you follow history Ivar conquered alot more lands than ragnar and all of his brothers.. and there's also no evidence he was crippled, some say he was either really swift and flexiable in battle and that's why he was named "Ivar the boneless" or had an erectile dysfunction, but, since the show stopped following history and twisted the entire thing then there's no way we can surely know what is about to happen. Hell there's also no evidence ragnar existed, most of the historical sources we have about the vikings come from about 100-200 years after the viking age ended and were found on english lands written in latin.

Yuval Vernik Yeah, the show takes a lot of liberties with history, which honestly doesn't bother me, it makes the show less predictable and given the mystery that the Viking age is shrouded in, it feels like an appropriate period with which to get a bit creative. I like Ivar being crippled, it makes his character more interesting and relatable. I do think Ivar will do amazing things in the show, but I also think that we will potentially see the beginning of Christian dominance in Scandinavia, most likely via Alfred, Headmund and Rollo. All of the visions of Ragnarok that the seer is having are presumably about this

The real Ivar was never in conflict with any of his brothers, on the contrary, he was his brothers‚Äôs the best advisor when it came to battles strategies and the Ragnarssons loved him for his cleverness, and Lagertha never killed Aslaug aswell this is pure fiction! In fact we don‚Äôt even know that much about the real Lagertha, all we know is how her and Ragnar met and how they got three children, Fridleif Ragnarsson and two unknown Ragnarsd√≥ttir. Of course Bj√∏rn isn‚Äôt Lagertha‚Äôs son in real life but Aslaug‚Äôs. And there is also Thora, Ragnar‚Äôs second wife who isn‚Äôt even portrayed in the tv show because the writer is horrible at developing characters. I didn‚Äôt mind that the tv show didn‚Äôt follow completely the Saga, but now it is honestly getting out of hands and it sounds and looks ridiculous, such a shame to the Saga. If the writer wanted Vikings to be pure fiction, he should have imagined characters that weren‚Äôt historically important.

Hell Angels The show doesn't pretend to be consistent with the sagas. Ragnar actually never met Lagertha, his fist wife's name was Thora, it wasn't Lagertha. His second wife was Aslaug, although she initially went by the name Kr√°ka. I'm not sure why you're suddenly getting upset with the show, it was nothing like Ragnar's saga from the beginning. Hirst clearly wants to tell his own story with characters loosely based off of characters from the sagas and real historical vikings. I have no problem with that and I disagree with you about his talent at developing characters, I think Vikings has some of the best character development I've ever seen in a show. One thing I will say is that it's a shame that there are very few movies and tv shows that are actually accurate to Scandinavian history and to the sagas and I hope that people don't watch Vikings and think that it's accurately representing how things went down in the real history and in the sagas. I appreciate your passion for Scandinavian sagas and history though, I share that passion. Have a good day

Bob Smith Some people say that Lagertha existed and some people say she didn‚Äôt, we will never know for sure but I would have loved to see Thora portrayed in the tv show, and some other Ragnarssons aswell who are missing in the tv show. I don‚Äôt mean to offend anyone who loves the tv show, I get very passionate when it comes to Norse mythology and Nordic culture in general, you‚Äôre right we need more accurate movies or tv shows that portray the wonderful culture of the Norsemen and Norsewomen. I am aware that Hirst never followed the Saga even from the beginning of season 1 but I still enjoyed the tv show until season 4a. I have a hard time to keep up with the storyline now.... anyways thanks for respecting my opinion and have a nice day lad!
Ragnar and Ivar would be like father and som if Ragnar would have seen him fight.  But Ivar kills Bjorn I think.  I hate to see my favorite characters die.
Selma Faria  your so right on  que Viking Sister

@Warsaw Pact We could only guess which fates the creators of the show would create for each character but by history, Ivar dies by disease and Bjorn dies of old age, however, the show tends to steer away from what really happened.
You hypercrit! Ivar is a spoiled little mothers boy. He killed his own brother, his mother was a witch who had no loyalty to anyone but herself. Ivar is a powty chiled. Bjorn is a king in the making

@Kye Return And yet Bjorn lacks a lot of leadership knowledge and he isn't as tactical and wise as Ivar. He might act and look like mother's little boy but take hold of the facts man if Bjorn alone would have led an army against Ivar I'd bet every dime that Ivar would win the fight because of his strategic mind, his ability of Intimidation, and his lack of fear aka his confidence. As I said before the only way Bjorn could destroy Ivar is if he could catch him in a single duel, then yes, Ivar has almost no chance surviving.

Kye Return Eh, you're being a little harsh on Ivar. He's had to deal with being physically disabled within a society that values athleticism and fighting ability above almost anything else. He's had to watch as his brothers become great warriors, sleep with women and inherit the reputation and responsibilities of the great Ragnar Lothbrok, whilst he's laughed at and underestimated. As for Aslaug, I think she felt understandably neglected and mistreated by Ragnar and that turned her into a very bitter person, but I honestly think she gets it worse than she deserves from the fans and if she is a witch, so what? I agree that Ivar shouldn't have killed Sigurd, but the anger issues that he has developed are understandable. All that said, I think Ubbe is my favorite of Ragnar's sons. Just some thoughts
i kinda agree exept he is pretty stuck up XD
@Kye Return And guess who ended up with the most land of the 4 bros...

Ivar is the biggest (and dumbest) idiot of them all, with no arc whatsoever. He is consistently being clever strategically and among men, but manipulated like a pussy, by a girl.. Killed his own brother (the one he tried to kill 2 times before), disregarded his older AND wiser ones.. Ivar's rage is not justified, it's a justification for being a cripple, incapable of having sex or fighting like other Vikings. Ubbe is the smartest of them all, all it took him to become the closest thing to his father, is living through bad decisions and defeats. Ragnar said that one learns from defeats. If you're right one time, that doesn't make you right in the future. This is where Ivar failed his father the most (apart from tearing his family apart) - in contrast with Ubbe, who always had the big picture in perspective, but made some bad calls early in his leadership days, which will make him a force to be reckoned with in the future of the show, i'm sure.
@Bob Smith Ubbe is awesome, the only one with the big picture on his mind. Made some early mistakes, but that made him much wiser.

The Great Deceiver Agreed, he‚Äôs very clever and of Ragnar‚Äôs sons he is by far the most in control of himself. Bjorn, Ivar and Hvitserk are all very temperamental, and even though Ivar is very clever, he gets himself into trouble with his massive ego and confrontational, contrary nature. Ubbe does what has to be done for the good of his people, Ragnar would be quite proud of him

@Bob Smith Agreed. I'll go as far as to say that Ubbe is the only character that can save Vikings. It's in free fall for a while since Ivar is so irreconcilably evil and stupid around Freydis. I was expecting a lot from King Harald.. But he's just the same, being fooled and tricked all the time for no particular reason.

The Great Deceiver Honestly, I‚Äôve liked season 5 a lot more than everyone else so far, I think the reason that Hirst is making Ivar so unlikable is to provide us with a villain. Since Ragnar was avenged there hasn‚Äôt really been a villain so it seems like Ivar has taken up that mantel. As for Harold, I like that he was deceived by Ubbe, I think it worked to establish Ubbe‚Äôs cleverness and Ragnar-esque trickster skills. Hvitserk is really coming into his own, Lagertha‚Äôs story is clearly coming to an end in an interesting way, Bjorn‚Äôs been set on a trajectory towards Ivar in a way that doesn‚Äôt feel contrived and Harold is his natural ally in his war against Ivar, especially in the wake of his defeat against Alfred. As for Alfred and Ubbe, I love their relationship and I‚Äôm excited about the future of their story. I will say, I‚Äôm not sure I liked the killing of √Üthelred, I would have liked to see him make amends for his disloyalty and fight alongside Ubbe and Alfred against the Danish Vikings. I‚Äôm not sure about Floki‚Äôs story, we‚Äôll see what happens

Their own mother didn't even love them. Only Ivar and the wanderer who she cheater Ragnar with. Aslaug did nothing and weren't even a mother to them, her actions almost led to the death of Ubbe and Hvitserk. We clearly aren't watching the same show since you are so ignorant. And no, Torvi hasn't been trough much, not compared to the other characters.
